page.title: 04CHEW VALLEY LAKE FISHING
page.content: The lake is designated an area of specific scientific interest by the Nature Conservancy Council. It is stocked with brown and rainbow trout and fished by thousands of anglers every year. Bristol Waterworks Company operates a staggered restocking policy with fish from its own hatcheries and rearing ponds.The lake has the reputation of having the finest lake trout fishing in Europe.The fishing season is May to October and fishing permits can be obtained from Woodford Lodge.Both boat and bank fishing are allowed in specified areas.The annual licence for 1985 costs Â£400. Water Bailiffs operate a 24 hour radio controlled watch to prevent poaching.
